name: systemically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
biology
  specialized (of a drug, disease, poison, etc.) in a way that reaches and affects the whole of a body or a plant and not just one part of it: Intravenous pain medication is absorbed systemically. Antibiotics were administered systemically for 3 days.
formal in a basic and important way that involves the whole of an organization or a country and not just particular parts of it: It is important to look at the infrastructure as a whole and tackle the issues systemically. The authorities will step in to prevent the collapse of systemically important banks.
More examplesFewer examplesHospitalization is reserved for children who have become systemically unwell from their skin infection.There was no significant difference in recovery period between the animals treated systemically and those treated locally.Views differ on how this social problem should be managed, both systemically and at an individual level.
